nl.marcvanzee.KEProver.GUI
Class Main

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Panel
              java.applet.Applet
                  javax.swing.JApplet
                      nl.marcvanzee.KEProver.GUI.Main
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer
public class Main
extends javax.swing.JApplet

The main class that runs the program as a JApplet. The FormulaEditor class is placed on a Container, and formulas are collected from this class when the button "load" is pressed The resulting formula is first parsed, and then sent to the SAKE prover. SAKE.isProvable() will try to prove the formula when "prove" is pressed. The resulting prove will be stored in the SAKE object, and requested when "show" proof is pressed.

Author:
Marc van Zee
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

init

public void init()
initialize the Applet. Disable buttons, place elements and add button listeners.

Overrides:
init in class java.applet.Applet

addElements

private void addElements()
Place elements on the Applet. Create a FormulaEditor object and place it in a Container.

addButtonListeners

private void addButtonListeners()
Add listeners for all the buttons.
the load button retrieves all formulas from the FormulaEditor object when clicked,
using the getSubFormulas() method, and then inserts the formula into the SAKE object.

the refute button asks the SAKE object to prove the formulas. if it succeeds, the proof tree button is enabled.

the proof tree button prints the proof

getSubFormulas

private java.util.Vector<Subformula> getSubFormulas()
Collect the formulas from the listbox in FormulaEditor and return them as a Vector of Subformulas. This is the input format that SAKE requires.

msg

public void msg(java.lang.String str)
send a message to the textfield on the right side of the Applet.
